intro: Desmocladus biformis, commonly known as the two-lobed desmocladus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
